trustfund: TF034662-CROATIA - MUNICIPAL ENVIRONMENT INFRASTRUCTURE,TF025799-PHRD-CAPACITY BLDG.-MUNICIPAL ENVIRON.INFRASTRUCTURE,TF029486-PHRD-MUNICIPAL ENVIRON.INFRA.INVEST.PROJ.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Municipal Environmental
            Infrastructure Investment Project involves the construction
            of a sewerage system in the Kastela Bay that covers the
            municipalities of Split, Solin, Kastela, and Trogir to
            reduce the existing high environmental pollution.  This
            environmental assessment aims at assessing potential
            environmental consequences of the project; and recommending
            measures that should be taken in order to maintain
            conditions for the protection of the marine environment in
            the sea.  During the construction of the collecting system,
            the impact of odor will be mitigated by ventilators and
            filters for air cleaning.  Noise will be reduced by burying
            the structures under ground and sufficiently apart from
            residential areas.  When constructing the treatment plants,
            unpleasant odors and aerosols will be mitigated by forced
            ventilation of the entire indoor space. Solid wastes
            associated with the operation of the treatment works will be
            properly disposed of.  For instance, screenings will be
            washed, dewatered, and disposed at a sealed landfill site.
            To prevent fresh and sea water pollution, the submarine part
            of the outfalls will be protected from wave and anchorage
            impacts by burying and concreting the pipes to the point of
            8 meters of sea water depth.  The problem of vibration of
            the outfalls as a result of air penetration into the pipes
            will be eliminated by the construction of an appropriate
            ventilation shaft.
